abstract: Commerce Department rules allow companies to keep their involvement anonymous to avoid retaliation by other countries.
snippet: Commerce Department rules allow companies to keep their involvement anonymous to avoid retaliation by other countries.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — One of the most striking features of the trade case filed Wednesday by seven solar panel makers in the United States lies not in what appears in the public docket, but what does not: the names of six of the seven companies.

headline.main: Six Companies Stay Anonymous in Solar Case
headline.print_headline: Six Complainants in Trade Case Are Unnamed
